column1:
Telcontar,"2013-06-26T23:32:20.163Z","Cool Minifg, But Only Worth It For Superhero Fans","

Jor-El, the biological father of Superman, is
column2: a pretty cool minifig to own.&nbsp
column3: He is exclusive, but still not that exciting as I'll explain later.&nbsp
column5: I haven't seen Man of Steel yet so I don't know if he looks anything at all like Jor-El from the films.&nbsp
column6: There's no Man of Steel logo on the polybag so I tend to think not.&nbsp
column8: His torso (which has some printing on the back)&nbsp
column9: and leg design is very similar to&nbsp
column12: for the cape and behind the iconic ""S"" it's a dark brown so you can easily tell&nbsp
column14: His head (which is not double sided) looks&nbsp
column15: similar to a few other heads I own, but I&nbsp
column18: brown hair is available in many other sets.&nbsp
column19: Because he's named Jor-El it makes him a cool minifig to own.
column23: Brown capes are always nice but you can get them for cheaper than this.&nbsp
column25: is almost identical to Superman's and his hair piece is everywhere.&nbsp
column27: If you got him for spending&nbsp
column30: If you didn't get him then you didn't miss out on too much.&nbsp
column31: Unless you're a big superhero fan I wouldn't spend $20+ to get him off ebay.&nbsp

column1: Professor_X,"2015-09-30T21:56:57.947Z","""You will give the people of Earth an ideal to strive towards.""","
column2: Jor-El is a minifigure that I&#39
column4: get my hands on for a couple years now, Not only because I like Jor-El but because I am a big Russell Crowe fan. So naturally, when it showed up on Bricklink for an amazingly low price, I HAD to get my hands on it! Is Jor-El&nbsp
column5: a must have LEGO Shop exclusive, or just a promo from a short-lived subtheme. Read on to find out...

column2: While I really like the Jor-El minifgure, I assume he&#39
column3: s based on some abandoned concept art because&nbsp
column5: t resemble his movie appearance at all. From the neck down, Jor-El&nbsp
column6: is almost exactly like the Man of Steel version of Superman, with his S symbol colored brown rather than red. From the neck up, however, Jor-El is obviously very different, sporting a brown cape, a single-sided head piece that resembles Russell Crowe very accurately, and a dark-brown&nbsp
column7: tousled hair piece used extensively since the release of the Mutt Williams minifigure back in 2008.

column2: If you are a fanatical superhero minifigure collector like me or a Russell Crowe fan, it might bother you not to own this minifigure. But if you don&#39
column3: t fit either of those categories, then I would say Jor-EL probably isn&#39
column4: t worth his usual asking price on Bricklink&nbsp
column5: ($17.00 CA, $13.00 US). Of course, if you find one far below the asking price (I got mine for nearly half of what it&#39
column6: s worth normally!) then you should definitely pick it up. Otherwise, you may want to consider other minifigures&nbsp
